medical_history.chief_complaint: Focal abdominal pain localized to the right lower quadrant (RLQ)
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The abdominal pain began around 8AM this morning, described as dull, moderate, and localized to the RLQ. Shortly after the onset, the patient experienced nausea and vomited twice. No positions alleviated or worsened the pain. The patient reported mild appetite, subjective fevers, but denied any night sweats or chills.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Right hip surgery, left knee orthoscopic surgery; no other reported past medical history.
medical_history.family_history: Father died from prostate cancer, otherwise no other history of malignancy.
